data.title: Friends Reunion
data.text: We saw this while in historic Savannah and heard all the laughter and decided to join in. We are so glad we did. We had a great guide and went to some really fun bars. We took turns peddling so super easy and lots of fun! Recommend to anyone that likes to drink, enjoys music and a good time!

data.title: Fun time
data.text: Had a fun time on this pubcycle. I would do it again. Plan to spend some dollars on the drinks though at the bar.

data.title: Slow riiide... take it easyyyy... or hard. But awesome!
data.text: Slow ride was so fun!! Coming from a girl who is not keen on mixing exercising and drinking... the pedaling is easy if everyone helps and it's a good challenge. Makes you feel less horrible about getting a drink at every bar haha. We had Holly as a guide and she was awesome. We were joined on our bike by her puppies - Libby and Faith - who were so cute!! You can have a friend plug in their phone to DJ the music and just sing and party to your heart's content. Open carry in Savannah allows you to grab drinks at the bars and bring them back to the bike. You have 15 minutes at each place, so it is a really cool way to check out a bunch of different bars if you are new to the area, without making a huge commitment. Would highly recommend!!

data.title: Really great staff but definitely for a younger crowd
data.text:
First off, my friend and I had a blast. We definitely got a good workout and the people working here are very nice and incredibly good-humored for what they probably have to deal with every day, all day. 
This is for a younger, can drink all day without a nap, listen to music I have never heard before, crowd. I would love to rent an entire bike with close friends and actually be able to hear what the guide is saying. 
Like I said, we still had fun and it was a great way to spend a couple of hours.

data.title: Great fun
data.text: This was great fun, ridding around historic Savannah with friends and family, the guide was very informative and interesting, we stopped at various venues for liquid refreshment, most enjoyable.

data.title: Absolutely awesome!
data.text: I have lived around Savannah for two years, and always saw people pedaling around. I thought, perhaps I will take my fiancé on one of those for her birthday. We did the pub crawl. It was fantastic! It was a lot fun than I ever expected. Our guide, Niko, was a great dude. He was so funny, and had the best music selection ever. It's two hours long, and you really pedal. So dress comfortable! It wasn't too bad as long as everybody put in the effort. We stopped at like 6 bars, and we had about 15 minutes at each bar. Just enough time to get yourself a beverage, and then get back on and drink some more. I was sober as a judge when I got on. By the end of the trip, I was feeling pretty awesome. So, this is a great way to see the city, meet great people, and get drunk. I highly recommend it!

data.title: Hard work, but big fun!
data.text: We had a really great time!  It was definitely harder work than we all expected, especially since there are 4 or 5 seats for non-pedalers.  Yes....that means that we were pedaling the added weight of those people who got to ride around for no effort.  Lazy! However, Niko was really fun and a great guide who gave us bar options at each stop.

data.title: Single women should not take this tour!
data.text: Our tour guide, Kevin, was a misogynistic creep who revels in humiliating women. We could not even finish the tour because of how humiliated we were by him. We were being stalked by some 60-something year old men that we had just met at lunch, prior to going on this tour. They literally followed us across town, in pedicabs and were following us bar to bar. We did not invite them, and had no control over the situation. They were drunk, creepy old stalkers. After the 2nd bar one of them attempted to climb onto one of the bikes, disregarding our protests! Kevin stopped the bikes..told the old man to stop what he was doing, and then threatened to kick US OFF THE "F ing" TOUR! He absolutely HUMILIATED us. (And who talks to a customer like that?) Of course, it must be our fault because we are women. He had all the older women at the front of the cart all riled up and upset at us and we were so upset at the situation and the men were still following us. He did not handle the situation well at all and we did not feel safe. We elected to leave at the next stop, telling Kevin that we were going to stop the tour at that point. When I called on Monday to speak to a manager, he told me that Kevin wrote up a report that stated we were kicked off the tour. The manager said it was basically he said she said, and he was electing to believe his employee and hung up on me. I can not recommend this tour to anyone. HORRIBLE SERVICE, TERRIBLE WAY TO RUN A BUSINESS.

data.title: Girl's Weekens
data.text: Great time. Cal was a very good guide. No need to rush your drink, just take it with you.  Open containers all around.

data.title: Maybe better under better circumstances
data.text: Warning, this is a lot of work.  Its not a leisurely ride.  They brought us to mediocre/empty bars and told us decent stories, which would probably have been better from a better guide.

data.title: Fun fun fun!!!!
data.text: Awesome ride! Lots of fun and laughs. Our driver Peter was very knowledgable and full of very interesting facts about Savannah! Thank you ! Would definately recommend to anyone!

data.title: Savannah Slow Ride
data.text: This is a peddle bar. No motor assistance. So, if you don't like strenuous peddling, don't do it. I went with my two friends. We are seniors but healthy. There were twelve others, (very young). The vehicle holds twelve peddlers and a bench seat on the back for three. We ended up sitting on the bench as our legs were worn out. Even the young ones were complaining how hard it was.  It looks like so much fun but it's hard work.

data.title: Girls reunion-friends since 1st grade!! Traveling here from all over the USA.
data.text: Hannah was our driver and was the absolute BEST.  It was an entire time of laughing and music and fun.  The pub crawl and all the bars stopped at were very open and accommodating to our group with no waiting to get our orders ready so we had plenty of time to get back on the slow ride.  Highly recommended for any size group-but be prepared to pedal.

data.title: Get a workout...have beer..seethe town!
data.text:
We come to Savannah often, but it has been a while since have been on the slow ride.
I think they have really steeped up their game since our last ride. Great people who work hard to let you have a good time. Looking forward to our next ride!

data.title: Really Fun!
data.text: We were on a girls' trip celebrating birthdays and with 10 of us we took up a whole "bike."  It was so much fun peddling around to the different places.  This was one of the most fun things we did while in Savannah - much more fun than a ghost tour!

data.title: Celebrating a 21st Birthday with daughter!!!
data.text: This was something my daughter wanted to do (Pub Crawl) for her 21st bday. It was so much fun and the ladies that we rode with were fun too for they were having a Bachelorette party! The ride was awesome and fun EXCEPT for the "arrogant and rude" driver that took us around. He was so rude (several times) and all of the ladies on trip were getting annoyed with him for his rude comments to me! It was somewhat uncomfortable but I was not going to let this Moron ruin our ride! With another driver, "it would have been perfect". None of the girls tipped him due to this rudeness! Otherwise a FUN TIME without him as the driver! (Plus he seemed like he was somewhat stoned!)

data.title: Great time riding around the city and drinking
data.text: This was a great experience for my husband's birthday. We had about 12 people on our bike and stopped at about 5 different places. The shop is in the heart of the drinking district so there isn't a lot of pedaling. We were able to bring all our drinks on the bike but, there really isn't enough time to drink them on the bike cause a couple mins later you were at the next stop so make sure to drink them at the bar. Overall it was a great time and highly recommend it.

data.title: Slow Ride Take It Easy
data.text: We did this as part of my niece's bachelorette weekend.  It was especially fun for me because I didn't have to peddle.  There is a bench seat that holds 3 people and 2 wheel well seats where no peddling is available.  We actually did the Architectural tour because the bride-to-be is an interior design major and likes that kind of stuff.  Our guide was very knowledgeable and we did make some stops so that we could take pictures and get a cold beverage.  It was a great 2 hour trip around several of the squares

data.title: Must-do bachelorette activity!
data.text: The Savannah Slow Ride Pub Crawl was so much fun! Our driver, Paul, really knew how to make all of us, especially the bachelorette, feel special. He gave us history of the area while steering us around to some of the popular bars/pubs in the area. This activity is a must for any bachelorette/bachelor, wedding party, or large group in Savannah!

data.title: So much fun...highly recommend!!!
data.text: Our first night in Savannah we chose the Haunted Boos Cruise and we had a blast! Not only did we get a nice tour of the city and some of the haunted tales there, but it was just a really fun night out! There were only two to our group so we joined a few other groups. We had so much fun together that we went out after the tour was over! Our tour guide was excellent. Definitely recommend!!
